meanings.definition: A starchy tuberous root, used as a staple food in tropical countries.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, cassava is a main source of food.
meanings.sent2: Farmers grow cassava for its starchy root.
meanings.sent3: Why did the potato go to the party with the cassava? They heard it was a tuber bash!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like cassava, providing a solid foundation for the project.
meanings.sent5: The cassava, with its starchy goodness, sustained the village through the harsh winter.

meanings.definition: The plant from which cassava is harvested.
meanings.sent1: The cassava plant requires specific growing conditions.
meanings.sent2: Farmers take great care of the cassava plant to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: Why did the gardener bring a ladder to the cassava plant? To help it reach new heights!
meanings.sent4: Her determination grew like a cassava plant, strong and resilient.
meanings.sent5: The lush green leaves of the cassava plant swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: The edible root of the cassava plant.
meanings.sent1: Cooking cassava roots requires proper preparation.
meanings.sent2: The chef peeled the cassava root before cooking it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the carrot blush? Because it saw the cassava root!
meanings.sent4: His words were as nourishing as the cassava root, comforting and satisfying.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cassava root filled the kitchen, promising a delicious meal.
